content.description: The reason I gave this a bomb is that I would not want anyone to come here thinking they could do a nice 5.7 crack. It is filled with moss (at least from close inspection on the ground) and the pro looks sparse and questionable.
content.protection: Big (think #4 camalots and up) there might be some spots for smaller gear but it appeared to be full of moss
content.location: The big crack/chimney that goes up the left side of the main wall.

content.description: The crux comes at the top as you pull the short but steep headwall to gain the ledge. The Falcon guide book shows 4 bolts, however the first one has since been chopped leaving a spicy (yet easy) climb to the 1st bolt
content.protection: 3 bolts, no bolted anchors easy to setup anchors at the top though.
content.location: Joe Mamba is just to the right of Rodeo Revolution (aka the wide crack). Start by stepping into the right facing edge and head towards the dishes and the 1st bolt. It is a very obvious line of knobs.

content.description: The crux is pulling the steep overhanging (ever so slightly) head wall while pulling on small vertical crimps.
content.protection: The guide book says there are 6 bolts they are high quality Fixe anchors so no worries here in case you were to peel...
content.location: Closest to the 4th class gully takes the more direct yet blanker line up the center of the wall.
